info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 07 at 12:00PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Albany County through 1230 PM EDT... At 1159 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Westerlo, or 9 miles west of Delmar, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph, pea size hail, and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Heavy rains could cause flooding. Locations impacted include... Delmar, Westerlo, Voorheesville, Feura Bush, New Scotland, Rensselaerville, Clarksville, East Berne, Slingerlands, Snyders Corners, Meadowdale, Shoefelt Corners, Bensons Corners, Thompsons Lake, Guilderland Center, Thatcher State Park, South Berne, Reidsville, Bramans Corners and Elsmere. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
